ai-tha-ap317:0.3_0: The Elder Nuns, having given a flower
ai-tha-ap317:1.1_0: “A Buddha praised the appearance of a golden palanquin,
ai-tha-ap317:1.2_0: I was drunken on the rainy season.
ai-tha-ap317:1.3_0: not far away from the grove
ai-tha-ap317:1.4_0: their own psychic powers are fulfilled,
ai-tha-ap317:2.1_0: After going out to meet him,
ai-tha-ap317:3.1_0: raising his hands in respectful salutation,
ai-tha-ap317:3.2_0: I was born, and I was born.
ai-tha-ap317:4.3_0: because of that all the good,
ai-tha-ap317:4.4_0: I stain the poison of the Buddha.
ai-tha-ap317:5.1_0: if he makes his four eons;
ai-tha-ap317:5.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap317:7.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Scripture.
